intro: Tetragonotheca parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered tetragonotheca, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, adapting to arid environments. Tetragonotheca parviflora is often found in desert or semi-desert regions, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
